bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, August 25, 1896

div1.p: Lazear writes that he has cancelled his rendezvous with Sweitzer in Canada. His marriage to Mabel Houston is planned for September.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, August 25, 1896
div1.p:
A letter came
from you last Tuesday
and again on this morning.
I am glad to hear
that you got through
the hot weather so well.
It must have been
a terrible hot time
all over the east.
There was no sign
of it here.

We came down from
the ranch last week
stopping over a
night at Potter Valley
to avoid the early
start necessary for
making the trip in oner
day. San Francisco
feels like the Arctic
regions. It is extremely
cold and row. Foggy
most of the times.
The climate is right
really remarkable
no warm weather - no very cold
weather, no snow, no rain in
summer and very little in winter.
Before leaving the country I was
fortunate enough to kill a fine deer.
I had been out with a number
of parties but always unsuccessful.
At last tried it alone. About
four miles from the ranch up
the mountain I stirred up a
buck. I shot at him running
and thought I missed him.
However I found blood on his
trail and after a hard scramble
I got another shot which
laid him out. It is extremely
exciting sport, killing such large
game.

I do not think the people ought
to submit to the discount on
on their money. They
could make some
arrangement to have
their checks cashed
in Montreal.

Since reaching here
I have made inquiries
at the Canadian Pacific
office. I find that
the line to Baltimore
is by Toronto and
not Montreal and
that I would have
to pay a great deal
extra to go to Hatley
and lose a great
deal of time. I think
therefore that I had better
give up my trip then.
I am sorry but I
think it better to avoid
the expense. I hope
you will find someone
who is going about
the time you want to
go.

I have been expecting
a telegram from you
yesterday and today.
My letters take along
time to reach you.

If we are married it will
be about the 8th of Sep and
we will reach Baltimore
soon after the middle of
the month taking the ordinary
route by Omaha and Chicago.
I will write again as soon
as I hear from you
div1.closer:
Your affectionate Son Aug 25. 96
Thank you very much for the papers.
